results.title: The Heart and circulatory system
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Media-Four Productions
results.brief_description: Establishes the function of the circulatory system in transporting oxygen and the history of ideas about this. Harvey’s early experiments are shown and also microphotography of the heart. Developments in current heart research are shown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles L. Finance, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Media-Four Productions

results.title: Heard and not seen
results.creator_credit: A. Henley and Masters and Boys of Holloway School
results.brief_description: A boy sent out of art class for misbehaviour mixes a drink in the chemistry laboratory which makes him invisible. A series of amusing incidents ensue. Finally the effects wear off and he is caught in the headmaster’s office.

results.title: Health service in Britain
results.creator_credit: Frank Gardner and Central Office of Information
results.brief_description: A survey of medical treatment available under Britain’s National Health Scheme. Some of the medical attention which can be obtained on the advice of the general practitioner. Includes specialised services in pre-natal and post-natal care; ophthalmic, dental and orthopaedic treatment; chest clinics; mental health; geriatrics and rehabilitation centres.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Gardner and Central Office of Information

results.title: Health of a city
results.creator_credit: Riddell Black, Films of Scotland and Templar Film Studio
results.brief_description: In the early 18th century Glasgow grew into a sprawling, overcrowded city. The squalor and disease which came in its wake was widespread until a medical officer of health was appointed. Modern housing, mass radiography, child care and food examination of today point to the success of those early beginnings in health control.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Riddell Black, Films of Scotland and Templar Film Studio

results.title: Health in Greece
results.brief_description: Greece is today (1953) among the most devastated countries in Europe, with widespread poverty, sickness and suffering. Help has come from many countries, through the United Nations and other organisations; from Scandinavia, Switzerland, Britain and America. In addition, Greek people are being sent to other countries to gain the knowledge needed to set their country on the road to a better life.

results.title: The Health food movement
results.brief_description: The basic terms used by the health food movement are defined, and the activities of three typical health food advocates are used to explain details of the movement; an organic gardener, a manager of a health foods store, and a young family who eat mainly “natural foods”.

results.title: Head of the house
results.creator_credit: Richard Leacock, Irving Jacoby and Affiliated Film Producers
results.brief_description: A story of community action in mental health, showing how a social worker, a policeman and a minister join forces to help a young boy through the vicissitudes of growing up. This film stresses the relationship between the authoritarian attitudes of a father to his son and the boy’s psychological difficulties.

results.title: The Story of Long John
results.creator_credit: Alan Harper and Campbell Harper Films
results.brief_description: A film about the establishment of a new Long John Scotch Whisky at Tormore in the Scottish Highlands - the first completely-built distillery in the highlands in the 20th century. Workers’ homes and the distillery were designed to fit in with the landscape. Tormore was chosen because of its water quality. The process of distilling and blending is also featured.

Workers’ homes and the distillery were designed to fit in with the landscape. Tormore was chosen because of its water quality. The process of distilling and blending is also featured.

results.title: Hazard
results.creator_credit: Tom Stobart, Geoffrey Sumner and Interfilm Productions
results.brief_description: An accident prevention film intended primarily for showing to new workers entering the steel industry. Aims at a person’s attitude to safety rather than suggesting specific safety rules, through the story of two steelworkers on a mountaineering holiday. Compares their attitude to risks in the mountains with a professional attitude to risks on the job.
